results.title: Stages
results.creator_credit: Robert Mellor and Macau Light Films
results.brief_description: Stage and screen director Peter Brook and performers from the Centre for International Theatre discuss their approach to drama. Excerpts from the play “L’Os”, “Ubu Roi”, “The Ik” and “The Conference of the Birds” which were performed in a disused quarry during the 1980 Adelaide Festival of Arts, illustrate their innovative approach to theatre.

results.title: Stage struck (PC & MAC)
results.brief_description: The Australian performing arts makes its debut on the interactive stage with this vibrant CD ROM. Embark on an exciting tour of the theatre, visiting the various studios to construct a costume, create a script, or design and direct your own show. As you explore backstage you will discover a wealth of information on Australia’s entertainment industry. Take a tour on stage with a stage manager, or hang out in the Green Room with the artists and discover the range of performing arts companies. This CD ROM was made possible through a collaboration between NIDA (National Institute of Dramatic Art), the University of Wollongong, The Australian Ballet, Opera Australia, and the Sydney Opera House. Easy to install, nice graphics and good sound. Comes with an instruction sheet to assist with navigation. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: For Windows, Pentium PC, 16MB RAM, 2 speed CD-ROM drive, Windows 95, sound card, 640x480 display (256 colour). For Macintosh, Power PC Macintosh, 8MB free RAM, 2 speed CD-ROM drive, System 7.5, 640x480 display (256 colour).

results.title: Repulsion motor principles
results.creator_credit: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 5 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Explains construction of repulsion motor, rotor circuits and effects of brush position; short-circuiting and brush-lifting mechanism; and application of repulsion motors. This film is a technical training film on the design and construction of repulsion brush type electric A.C. motors as used in the first half of this century.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.description:

results.title: Single-phase and polyphase circuits
results.creator_credit: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
A training film explaining a single-phase synchronous generator; the use of sine curves to illustrate flow change; a two-phase system and three-phase system and ways to simplify wiring.

results.title: Split-phase motor principles
results.creator_credit: Ray-Bell Films and United States. Office of Education
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Electrical work: electrical machinery”.
Construction of stator and rotor; comparison of winding in two-phase stator with split-phase stator; effects of winding resistances and inductive reactances; and use of capacitor to produce phase displacement.

results.title: Sports for elementary: playing basketball
results.creator_credit: Gregory Valtierra, Gilbert George Klevens and Cinema Education
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the skills and techniques necessary for playing basketball. Covers passing, catching, dribbling, pivoting, and shooting. Suitable for primary level.
